fields.description:
Clicking on any report that is generated from JIRA Agile will redirect you to a simple jql issue query, rather than the Agile report.

For instance, the burn down chart should take you to something like this:
https://OnDemand_url/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=11&view=reporting&chart=burndownChart&sprint=50

But, instead, it will take you to:
https://OnDemand_url/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20Project_key

Note that the associated tool tip (on hover) is also broken.
fields.summary: Agile report links are broken on the JIRA project reports page

fields.description:
When you export OD instance that has mail handlers configured and you import it to your local server you will not be able to re-use mail servers.

Basically they will have the hostname set to localhost, but after you fix that they will still not work. This is caused by our OD configuration - we use SOCKS in OD and we store SOCKS configuration for each mail server.

Editing a mail server doesn't clear those socks settings when in BTF. So you need to remove and recreate all mail servers to make them usable.

Also this implementation is broken for OD - what if we're going to update SOCKS settings? They are now stored so the old settings will be picked up. Fail!
fields.summary: JIRA should ignore socks configuration when running mail handlers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
API calls Generate Logoff event for all users on system

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
With Incoming API requests to JIRA or Confluence, On Random API calls the JIRA system sends an additional Verification request as an anonymous user system account, then sends a secondary logoff event for the anonymous session without a token as described in {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2842}} , causing all users to be logged off of the system.
- No Definite time interval can be identified, and has been seen to occur as often as every 3 min and spaced out as far as 5 hours
- But it is a steady interval per instance, indicating rate of request causing the log-off event

h3. Expected Results
- API calls do not cause force log-off event

h3. Actual Results
- All users logged of system at a timed interval
The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{code}
@40000000554b9a6b099afdf4 2015-05-07 12:01:21,159 TP-Processor19 WARN [engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper] SQL Error: 0, SQLState: 23505
@40000000554b9a6b099b01dc 2015-05-07 12:01:21,159 TP-Processor19 ERROR [engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper] ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cwd_token_identifier_hash_key"
@40000000554b9a6b099b05c4 2015-05-07 12:01:21,159 TP-Processor19 ERROR [jdbc.batch.internal.BatchingBatch] HHH000315: Exception executing batch [could not perform addBatch]
{code}
then triggers log off event:
{code}
TP-Processor15 INFO [crowd.manager.authentication.TokenAuthenticationManagerImpl] Removing all user and application tokens
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Due to some recent API changes session tokens are being removed frequently. Hence, users are being logged out quite often. For this to be resolved all the applications need to be using the latest version of embedded crowd and that version is 2.8.3. 

h3.Workaround
No Workaround currently available
fields.summary: Upgrade Crowd to 2.8.3+
Indexing error with Charting Plugin
Copy the value from field to 'Component/s' field no longer works

fields.description:
The "Using XML to create a workflow" page at  (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Using+XML+to+create+a+workflow) does not apply to JIRA Cloud. 

In fact, it's a restricted function as mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand#RestrictedFunctionsinAtlassianOnDemand-JIRA] under the "Importing XML workflows into JIRA" page.
fields.summary: Remove the "Using XML to create a workflow" page from the JIRA Cloud documentation

fields.description:
h3. Expected results:

When I request a missing image file, the response will be HTTP 404 and one of the following will be true
* the response entity contains HTML and the {{content-type}} is {{application/html}} or {{text/html}}
* the response entity is an image and the {{content-type}} is {{image/<image-sub-type>}}

h3. Actual results:

When I request a missing image file, the response is HTTP 404, the response entity contains HTML, and the {{content-type}} is {{image/jpeg;charset=ISO-8859-1}}

h3. Steps to reproduce

I'm a little unsure if this is reliable, because I still haven't determined why my attachment 404'd to begin with.

# attach a JPEG image to an issue
# navigate to that image in a browser
# delete the attachment
# refresh the browser tab that held the image
fields.summary: HTML 404 response incorrectly identifies itself as image/jpeg

fields.description:
Cloud instances with timezones in Moscow are showing due dates with one day behind after setting them.

By checking the database, we can see that the dates are correct, they are only displayed incorrectly.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have a Cloud JIRA instance with system timezone in Moscow
#* It doesn't work with user timezone settings in profile, the system timezone must be Moscow
# Create an issue
# Set the timezone, for example to 12/31/2015

*Expected behavior*
* Due date displays the inputed date (12/31/2015)

*Actual outcome*
* It displays the date of the previous day (12/30/2015)

*Workaround:*
Raise a support ticket (support.atlassian.com) and ask to change the instance timezone from Moscow to another city GMT+3
fields.summary: Due date is automatically decreased when set in Cloud instances with system timezone in Moscow (Russia)

fields.description:
Tested with Safari: Version 7.1 (9537.85.10.17.1)

When creating new user and select:
{code}
Email a link to the user to set their password
{code}

h3.Expected Behavior
Invitation e-mail is sent to newly created user

h3.Actual Behavior
E-mail is not sent to user to set password

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome browser to create new user OR manually set user passwords
NOTE: Chrome will not work if incognito mode is used
fields.summary: New user Invitation password e-mail not sent when created in safari

fields.description:
With the property "jira.permission.comment.user" set to "denied" for a "Done" issue status (in order to prevent users adding further comments to resolved issues), the comments field still appears on the issue resolution screen associted with this transition.

Due to the above property, when a user tries to enter a comment on the resolution screen, an error message appears stating _"[username], you do not have the permission to comment on this issue."_.

This causes confusion, hence one/both of the following changes would be useful:
- allow the final comment on the transition screen to be entered before removing the permission
- add the option to remove the comments field from transition screens
fields.summary: With jira.permission.comment.user = denied, comments field still appears on resolve screen

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project and give the browse project permission to everyone.
2. Navigate to the JIRA instance's base url. Notice that the dashboard is shown.
3. Click on the login link and login.

Expected Result:
After login users are taken to MyJIRAHome.

Actual Result
Users are taken to the dashboard because, the dest-url is set to be /secure/Dashboard.jspa
fields.summary: In OnDemand, users are no longer taken to MyJIRAHome upon login if anonymous users can see the dashboard
Horizontal scrolling on issue nav with large numbers of columns

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Issue Collector with several custom fields
# Open the issue collector on a live site

h3. Expected Results
The issue collector will display a dialog that shows most or all of the fields on the form

h3. Actual Results
The dialog is very small and only shows one field, and you have to scroll and can't see anything. It's awkward.
 
h3. Notes
We have several documented cases where the JIRA Issue Collector does not display correctly. It's not tall enough for the number of fields that are included in the form, and produces some awkward scrolling.

This can be reproduced by clicking the "Site feedback" link in the header on [marketplace.atlassian.com|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/]

h3.Solution / Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issue collector dialog height renders incorrectly sometimes

fields.description:
JIRA doesn't allow users to create issues within a project if there is no standard type of issue type (expected behavior). When users create a project where all the issue types' type of that project are *sub-task*, JIRA will display general error message and it's confusing the users.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Delete *Task* issue type from https://<instance-name>/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa
# Create a new *Task* issue type with *Sub-task* type
# Create a _Simple Issue Tracking_ project, it will use 2 issue types (Task and Sub-Task) but both are *Sub-task* type
# Create a new issue for that project

*Current Result:*
- Error message displayed 
{{The JIRA Server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation. Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser}}

*Expected Result:*
- JIRA should display the specific error message so that users know what can be done.

*Workaround:*
# Edit *Task* issue type and rename it to something else (e.g Task_2)
# Create a new issue type called *Task* with *Standard* type
# Edit _Issue Type Scheme_ of that project, remove *Task_2* (type:sub-task), and add *Task* (type:Standard) issue type into it.
fields.summary: Unable to create issues when there is no standard type of issue type within a project

fields.summary: The images for the different types of custom fields are broken/missing

fields.description: The problem is when we're creating multiple sub-tasks one after the other, information from the first sub-task not being copied from one you've just filled out to the next when using the "create another" check box.
fields.summary: Custom fields not pre-populated after creating an issue with the 'create another' option

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a new project and use _IN_ as the project key.
# Go to https://<instance name>/projects/IN/issues
(This example we use *IN*, there are a list of reserved words on the comment below)

*Expected Behavior:*
- JIRA should display issues of _IN_ project

*Current Behavior:*
- JIRA doesn't display any issues

Checking from the network request {{/rest/issueNav/1/issueTable}}, it returns _404 Bad Request_ with the below response:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got 'IN'. You must surround 'IN' in quotation marks to use it as a value. (line 1, character 11)"],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

NOTE: it only affects the *Project Navigation*'s issue panel, reverting to the old project view will workaround this issue at the mean time.

*Workaround*
Change the Project Key of your project. Make sure it avoids one of the Reserved JQL words (see [this comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42216?focusedCommentId=706911&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-706911]).
fields.summary: Creating a project using Reserved Words of JQL as project key breaks the new project navigation issue view

fields.description:
When opening the Activity Stream feed JIRA serves it as the incorrect Content type. This causes some browsers and readers to fail to properly recognise the XML as a real RSS feed.

*JIRA's RSS feed response*
!jirarss.png!

*The proper response*
!websiterss.png!
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream serves the RSS feed as text/plain instead of Application/rss+xml

fields.description:
Clicking on the "Refresh All Applications Link" icon causes the list of URLs to display incorrectly. Refreshing page afterwards causes the hamburger menu to display the incorrect URLs listed when clicking on icon. Another page refresh, restores back to previously listed URLs on the hamburger menu. 

*See attachments*

Tested in Firefox {{34.0}} and Chrome {{Version 39.0 (64-bit)}}. 

Tried clearing cache/cookies, re-indexing. 

Recreated on test instance

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to JIRA > Application Navigator
2. Click "Refresh All Applications Link" icon in top right
3. Click top left hamburger/dropdown menu 

h3. Expected: \\
Displays correct links/URLs

h3. Actual: \\
Incorrect URLs and causes menu to temporarily show/hide links
fields.summary: "Refresh All Applications Link" icon not working correctly in Application Navigator

fields.description:
When trying to create a project in Chrome, customers are hitting into *"Retrieving additional project types you might want to create"* error message that seems to never goes away. 

*Steps to reproduce*

1. Click 'add project'
2. Select any project type
3. Next window will just show a spinner at the bottom left with the text 'Retrieving additional project types you might want to create'

*Workaround*
# The current solution is to wait for a while (~ 1 minute). It will eventually load. 
# Use a different web browser such as Firefox or Safari.
fields.summary: In Chrome 'add project' has a long lasting spinner that prevent projects from being created

fields.description:
When create a new user and set the expiration time for the password link sent by email to up than 7 days the link will expire early. More precisely in 7 days.
Tested on two instances and if the expiration is more than 7 days it will expire in 7 days.
Setting for less than 7 days will work fine.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create any user on JIRA (e.g. test@atlassian.com)
# Create another user on JIRA (e.g. test@jira.com)

*Expected Results:*
There is no documentation about it. But I suggest the system to create the user with something like 'test1' when the username already exists.

*Actual Results:*
The system is creating a 'random' username. E.g.: u15

*Notes:*
Since customers lost their ability on managing usernames, they are already complaining that this behavior impacts mainly companies that are audited or are supposed follow governance processes (like Sarbanes–Oxley, COBIT, etc).

Also, customers'd like to have the ability to manually set the user's properties when creating them.
fields.summary: Creation of username is not meaningful when possible username already exists

fields.description:
as noted in The workaround is noted [HERE | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/HowTo%3A+Bulk+Edit+Resolution] a bulk move will fix this scenario

This was Semi addressed in issues https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-32546 and the resolution was to limit the result set to 1000, and add longer timeout yet the issue still exists if you perform a bulk move on >300 to 400 issues it causes timeouts to occur or system crashes while performed under load (If anyone is using the system at the time this is done).

h3.Two Options to fix this:
# the limit should have been set to 300 per operation rather than 1000
# Address the ability of users to be able to limit results set via the JQL per a wont fix ticket:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31384
- AND add a warning to the bulk move operation identifying the timeout can occur if system is under load.
- AND/OR force log users out when operation is performed like the Full lock and re-index option to reduce system load for the operation to occur successfully.

This is causing Confusion for the Fix and a lot of extra time and effort to resolve by needing to select 300-400 issues manually per bulk move operation.
fields.summary: Bulk operation with over 300 issues

fields.description:
The *Auto refresh* option doesn’t seem to be working properly. The chart is not being automatically refreshed.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# add the *Created vs. Resolved* chart to your dashboard selecting the *Auto refresh* option
# open another tab or browser and either create or resolve an issue returned by the gadget filter
# wait 15 minutes (the amount of time displayed on the gadget configuration)

*Expected Behaviour*
The gadget is updated accordingly (either created or resolved number of issues is incremented)

*Actual Behaviour*
The gadget is NOT updated
fields.summary: Created vs. Resolved Chart is not being refreshed

*Steps to reproduce*
Apparently, this is happening when you add a user to a project role and then delete the user without removing it from the project role:
# Add a user 
# Add it to a project role
# Delete the user without removing from the project role

*Outcome*
# Project Roles page becomes blank

*Workaround*
# Recreate the user with the same data (username, etc.)
#* The page will be available again
# Delete the user from the project role
# Delete the user

fields.description:
Please close this issue, this bug was due to mail connection problems.

??{color:#707070}-Hi,

I noticed that mail with an object containing curly brackets will not be processed by the incoming mail handler. A google search did not show me anybody reporting this issue.
Could you confirm this is an issue, and if it is, tell me if a fix can be done?

Steps to reproduce :
- set up an incoming mail handler on a mail address with "Create a new report or add a comment to an existing report" manager,
- send a mail to this mail address with an object containing curly braces,
- check that the mail stands in the recipient mailbox,
- check that no issue is created.

Thank you for your attention,
Best regards,

Jerome @ Sport-Decouverte (France)-{color}??
fields.summary: [To delete] Incoming mail handler fails to create issue when braces in mail object

fields.description:
h2. Disclaimer

{{NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED}} error actually means that the DOM Quota (cache) in a browser is already maxed out therefore unable to download further. Typical browsers will allocate the DOM Quota default around 5MB per domain. Some browser manage it per tab basis.

A more technical explanation on DOM Quota:
{quote}
The Web Applications 1.0 specification defines a mechanism allowing web pages to store information with a web browser (similar to cookies) called “client-side session and persistent storage.” This preference sets a hard limit on how much information any given site can store in this client-side storage. 
{quote}

It does not mean JIRA is having issue at that moment. Only browsers is affected.

h2. Problem Description

It has been observed to have an increasing thrend on the issue reported hitting to the {{NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED}} when browsing JIRA. Especially on loading Agile boards. 

h2. Expected Result

No error encountered, able to browse JIRA without fail for all supported browsers.

h2. Actual Result

Hit into {{NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED}} when browsing JIRA or opening board.

h2. Suspect

New features and analytical code might requires more quota on browser than we anticipated.

h2. Workaround

You can attempt to clear the [local storage (cache)|http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache] in attempt to recover from this error. Alternatively, Chrome reported to have a higher DOM Quota than Firefox.

In some cases, you will need to manually inject {{localStorage.clear()}} on the development console to clear the localStorage. 

Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6084099/how-to-view-delete-local-storage-in-firefox

h2. Notes/ Additional Information

Issues were reported mostly with Cloud instances as of the writing of this issue. If you are unsure whether you are affected by this, please raise a support ticket at support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: NS_ERROR_DOM_QUOTA_REACHED encountered while Browsing JIRA

On OnDemand instances, the feature is enabled by default at
{{<instanceURL>/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa}} when the documentation [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+JIRA+Options] specifies that it should be {color:green}Default: *OFF*{color}

This causes that on every OnDemand instance, the URL {{<instanceURL>/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa}} provides a form that anyone can send messages with to administrators.

It could be security problem as it doesn't contain a captcha.

fields.description:
h2.Summary

{quote}
I imported the attached CSV file (which contains a single issue with a 3hr 30min original estimate) using Issues -> Import Issues from CSV, and the new issue had an original estimate of 3 hours (see screenshot).

I imported the file using [Administration] -> System -> External System Import and the new issue had the correct original estimate of 3 hours 30 minutes.

I assumed the behaviour of both CSV importers would be identical.
{quote}

Basically there is a difference between the 2 importer and the value of the time fields are not correctly imported by issues > Import from CSV.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new Agile project. Make sure that the *Time Estimate* field is added to the right screen and project.
# Import using Issues -> Import Issues from CSV. Resulting ticket is refered as Ticket A.
# Import the file using [Administration] -> System -> External System Import. Resulting ticket is refered as Ticket B.

h2.Expected Result
The Remaining and Original Estimate field is showing different value. Ticket B is showing correct value while Ticket A is showing wrong value.

*Using Issue External Import*

!1.png|thumbnail!

*Using Administrator External System Import*

!2.png|thumbnail!

The correct time estimate value is 3 hours and 30 minutes.

h2.Current Result
The Remaining and Original Estimate field is showing same value for both Ticket A and B.

h2.Note
There are no error logs from Jira log during the import for both tickets. I've included test.csv for testing/replication purposes.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Fields not imported correctly by Issues --> Import from CSV

fields.description:
h2.Problem Description

This bug is closely related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42919 and it seems to be affecting other components like the JSON Export module and also the Issue Navigator.

h2.Steps to Replicate

Setting the timezone of your instance to -Duser.timezone=Asia/Beirut. Then add the due date field to your issue. Create an issue due date set at {{2015-03-29}}.

*Issue Navigator*

# Add the due column to the Issue Navigator.
# Attempt to search for the issues with due date set on {{2015-03-29}}.

*JSON Export*

# Enable the JSON module in JIM (JIRA Import Manager).
# Attempt to export the results from the Issue Navigator to JSON.

h2.Expected Results

*Issue Navigator*
Able to view the results without any error.

*JSON Export*
Able to export without issues.

h2.Current Results

*Issue Navigator*

!Untitled1.png|thumbnail!

{noformat}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in class com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.column.ColumnLayoutItemImpl threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at templates/jira/issue/table/macros.vm[line 117, column 34] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:507) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:71) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTSetDirective.render(ASTSetDirective.java:142)
{noformat}

*JSON Export*
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.DocumentIssueImpl.getDueDate(DocumentIssueImpl.java:291)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.views.IssueJsonView.convertIssueToExternalIssue(IssueJsonView.java:245)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.views.SearchRequestJsonView$1.collect(SearchRequestJsonView.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.statistics.util.DocumentHitCollector.collect(DocumentHitCollector.java:34)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:482)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:456)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchAndSort(LuceneSearchProvider.java:191)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}


h2.Workaround

*Issue Navigator*

# Hide the *Due Date* field and then re-index the instance. The Issue Navigator will now display the results without errors.

*JSON Export*

# No known workaround for now as the exporter gets all the value of the JIRA ticket regardless of whether the *Due Date* field is hidden or shown.
fields.summary: Daylight Saving Due Date Causing Issue Navigator to experience difficulty showing Due column and also causing errors to JSON export module

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue is loaded, it appears that if any attachments are attached to the issue, the issue will load in the attachments section of the screen instead of at the top of the issue when the issue is selected. This happens in all browsers.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Most recent version of Cloud
* All browsers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go into issue browser
# Select an issue that has an attachment (do not choose detailed view, just load the entire issue).

h3. Expected Results
The issue should load at the top of the page.

h3. Actual Results
The issue loads in the attachments section of the page.
 
h3. Notes
I've tested this in a test instance as well as a customer instance and was able to reproduce in both. Nothing unusual appears in the logs or the browser console.

h3.Workaround
Scroll up after page loads.
fields.summary: Issue Page Loads in Middle of Screen

fields.description:
# Create a new issue ==> Create Issue dialog box appears
# Enter information into dialog, including into several custom fields
# Make sure "Create another" checkbox is checked
# Click "Create" 

*Expected:*  A new Create Issue dialog box appears *with many fields already containing the information previously entered*
*Actual:*  The new Create Issue dialog box appears but *it is not retaining any information from the issue just created.*  The new dialog box is as empty as the first one was.

We often enter a a lot of items at one time. Having the values in various fields automatically filled in has been extremely helpful. *This was actually a BIG selling point for us to use Jira at all for task tracking.*

Suddenly not having this happen has made creating items a lot more of a pain for us.

{color:red}I assume that this long-existing functionality has been removed because some folks don't want the fields auto-filled. But presumably they'd be entering other data into (most of) those fields anyway. So if they already have data in them that doesn't make much of a practical difference to the "don't auto-fill" folks.
*But to those of us "DO auto-fill" folks, particularly those that have a lot of custom fields, it's a _VERY_ big deal.*{color}

I realize it's impossible to keep everyone happy, especially when they want opposite things.  But you could get very close if you make auto-filling another of the General Configuration settings like all the others on the System Settings page (https://[instance]/secure/admin/EditApplicationProperties!default.jspa).
fields.summary: Auto-fill has stopped working when creating multiple issues

fields.description:
Currently when you *Share* a JIRA issue with an email account which is not assigned to any specific user the JIRA mail handler will then allow that email address to add comments to the ticket  (the comments are then assigned to the default reporter set on the mail hander). But if that email contains an attachment the update will fails with a lack of permissions error.

*Steps to Replicate:*

# Create a ticket in JIRA
# Share that ticket with an email account that is not assigned to any JIRA Users
# Attempt to update the ticket (by referencing the issue key on the subject) from that email account which initially received the share, without any attachments.
# Perform the same test, now with attachments.

Step 2 will result in comments added to the ticket, this is what's shown on the logs:
{noformat}
2014-09-24 11:56:44.092096500 2014-09-24 11:56:44,092 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    TestHandler \[mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.1] Sender(s) \[example@email.com] not registered in JIRA. Using configured default reporter 'defaultreporter'.
2014-09-24 11:56:44.104649500 2014-09-24 11:56:44,104 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    Test \[atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] Test[10001]: Added comment 'Test after sharin... 'by 'defaultreporter' to issue 'TEST-1'
{noformat}

Step 3 will result in the following error:
{noformat}
2014-09-24 12:17:10.829007500 2014-09-24 12:17:10,828 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 DEBUG ServiceRunner    Comments from emails \[atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] The mail 'FROM' does not match a valid user
2014-09-24 12:17:10.829009500  This user is not in JIRA so can not add a comment: username <example@email.com>
{noformat}

Since JIRA allows comments to be performed by external users who were shared on the ticket it's expected that attachments added via email would work the same. This inconsistent behaviour will cause a lot of problems to users who use JIRA this way, resulting in comment updates received via emails from external customers being lost.
fields.summary: Email Accounts Not Assigned to any JIRA User Cannot Add Attachments to Tickets Using the Mail Handler

fields.description:
If you add the post function *'Assign the issue to the current user. Please note that the issue will only be assigned to the current user if the current user has the 'Assignable User' permission'* to the Create Issue transition in a workflow, supposedly if this transition is executed, the assignee will be changed to the current user who executed the transition but unfortunately the issue is remained unassigned. Beside that, the create issue notification is also not sent to the assignee even the assignee is specified during issue creation.

h3. To reproduce:

# Ensure the user is configured to receive the create issue notification.
# Create an issue with the user as assignee.
# Make sure the user receives the create issue notification
# Add the post function *'Assign the issue to the current user. Please note that the issue will only be assigned to the current user if the current user has the 'Assignable User' permission'* to the *Create Issue* transition in a workflow
# Create an issue for the project that uses the workflow with an assignee
# Check the assignee's inbox if the create issue notification is received or not.

The post function 'Assign to current user' is not suppose to be used in Create Issue transition.
fields.summary: Create issue notification is not being sent to assignee when I add 'Assign to current user' post function to the create issue transition.

fields.description:

{noformat}

We need to be able to handle issues with a high volume of comments. Some options from a similar issue on large comments and OOMES:
* only rendering the first N comments (where N may vary depending on the comment limit)
* calculate the size of the comments before loading them into memory, and do something different depending on whether they are above or below a certain threshold

Those are just 2 of many possible options. The important thing is that JIRA doesn't crash, and that we handle both dimensions (comment size and number of comments).

h3. Workaround
* Disable anonymous access if enabled - high volume of comments may be indicative of spam
fields.summary: JIRA dies with OutOfMemoryException when rendering issues with numerous comments

fields.description:
All users are being logged out every 1 minute on instances that are integrated with JIVE
https://www.jivesoftware.com/

It started happening on April 21st and affects all users, all browsers, all connections.

The apache access_log records:
{noformat}
165.254.226.241 204.93.64.4 - [28/Apr/2015:04:47:17 -0400] "POST /rest/auth/latest/session HTTP/1.0" 200 234 410634 "-" "Apache-HttpClient/4.2.4 (java 1.5)"
{noformat}

The IP: 204.93.64.4 belongs to JIVE Software: [whois|https://www.findip-address.com/204.93.64.4/whois] 

*Workaround:*
Disable JIVE integration or ask Cloud Support team to block all content from that IP until there is a permanent solution.

fields.description:
Jira reports the 404 not-found earlier than the 401 not-authorized. This discloses the (non-)existence of a specific issue numbers to unauthorized users. While this isn't a huge leak, this could come in useful with social engineering.

Proof of concept: Both of the calls below are unauthenticated, and should report a 401 status. Instead, the some report a 404 status.
{code}
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/issue/OS-0
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/latest/issue/OS-2
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/10201
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/attachment/10200
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/comment/10372/properties
curl -v https://cloudvps.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/comment/103720/properties
{code}
fields.summary: Information disclosure in the REST API

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
* On the dashboard, go to the introduction gadget and click on [JIRA 101 guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACloud/Get+a+feel+for+JIRA]

h3.Expected Results:
Loads documentation for link.

h3.Actual Results:
Observe page not found

h3.Additional Notes:
* Correct documentation can be found in CLDTST documentation space at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/JIRA+101
* Current link goes to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACloud/Get+a+feel+for+JIRA

fields.description:
Using the [Search Request View component|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/jira/search-request-view.html], JIRA will invoke the service passing "A comma-separated list of issue keys" for the issues.
When the amount of issues is very long, the URL passes the URL length limits and gets truncated by the browser, resulting in a 400 status and the request not reaching the service.

The list of JIRA issues can be extracted using the "link" parameter with the search query so adding the issues list as parameter, limits the amount of issues that can be sent to the add-on.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create an add-on and use the component [Search Request View|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/jira/search-request-view.html] to create an option on the Export button of Issue Navigator.
# Create a project in JIRA with 1000 issues. Make sure that the key of the project have the max allowed length (10 characters).
# Do a JQL search on the Issue Navigator that have 1000 issues
# Click on this add-on export option
*Result:* the url that JIRA will generate to call the add-on will be very large and the call will fail. For the 1000 issue keys, the size will be more than 10000 characters (1000 issues * 10+ characters of the issue key). These very large urls will not be able to be managed by browsers. Internet Explorer for example has a Maximum URL length of 2,083 characters. ([This blogpost|http://solvedstack.com/questions/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-url-in-different-browsers] a test shows that IE10 and IE11 max limit is 4043)
fields.summary: Search Request View module return a status 400 when passing too many issues

fields.description:
*Summary*

If a workflow is set up with a post function that automatically maps the assignee to a role or another field using [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions] an error is currently being thrown when transitioning the issue.

*Steps to replicate*

# Set up a workflow with a post-function that sets the assignee to the contents of another field, such as reporter.
# Transition an issue so that post-function occurs

*Expected Result*

Assignee changes

*Actual Result*

Error is thrown in the transition 'unable to copy value from reporter to assignee'

When editing the post-function the following value is shown:

{noformat}
$textutils.htmlEncode(${fieldValue})
{noformat}

*Workaround*

A workaround for now is to remove the post-function that automatically assigns issues and manually assign issues instead. If you do not want to trust all users to assign issues then your best bet is to restrict assign issue permission.

If the 'create issue originally' post function exists (in case it's the 'create' transition), moving the auto-assigning post function up, before the 'create' one has worked in some cases as a workaround.
fields.summary: Auto-assigning issues in JIRA Cloud transition throwing errors

fields.description:
JIRA Service Desk implements a plugin module descriptor on its side, which allows to embed webfragment based conditions in it (see [this page|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Web+Item+Plugin+Module#WebItemPluginModule-ConditionandConditionsElements]).

Whenever I try to use the {{com.atlassian.sal.api.features.DarkFeatureEnabledCondition}} provided by SAL, as in the following listing:

{code}
<my-custom-plugin-module key="..." name="..." class="...">
    ...
    <condition class="com.atlassian.sal.api.features.DarkFeatureEnabledCondition">
        <param name="featureKey">example.feature.key</param>
    </condition>
    ...
</my-custom-plugin-module>
{code}

, then the condition loading blows up because of not being able to inject the SAL {{com.atlassian.sal.api.features.DarkFeatureManager}}, with the following stack trace:

{code}
[atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] There was an error loading the descriptor 'XXX' of plugin 'XXX'. Disabling.

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
When new users are created, if the users do not choose a language setting other than the default language the _Language_ is set to -1. This then causes the date picker to break.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# _site-admin_ creates a new user
# When the user logs in for the first time, use the default language
!Screen Shot 2015-07-28 at 10.38.32 AM.png|thumbnail!
# The Language in the Profile Preferences will be set to -1
!Screen Shot 2015-07-28 at 10.27.26 AM.png|thumbnail!
# Try editing any issue 
# Add date using date picker
# An error is displayed : {{The JIRA Calendar does not currently support your language.}}
!Screen Shot 2015-07-28 at 10.43.29 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. ***Workaround***
Users needs to 
# Go to *Profiles*
# Edit *Preferences* 
# Click *Update*
# The language chosen will be applied
fields.summary: Date Picker Broken for New Users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Solution to the problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Issue collector uses cookies to ensure that all requests coming to the JIRA instance are legitimate. Unfortunately some browsers (mostly Safari) block 3rd party cookies by default - in other words cookies coming from other websites - and the very nature of issue collector is that you can embed it on any website you want meaning it becomes the 3rd party storing cookies. Unfortunately this means that users won't be able to create issues using the plugin in these browsers unless they enable 3rd party cookies support.

To enable third party cookies in Safari:
* Click the "Safari" menu
* Click "Preferences..."
* Click the "Privacy" menu
* For "Cookies and websites data" select "Always allow"

Another way to get around this is to use a different browser.
{panel}

h3. Summary
Getting an error when users are trying submit a feedback using Safari

h3. Environment
- Safari on iOS and Mac OS X
- Firefox on iOS

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an Issue Collector
# Copy the generated script and save it on html file
# Open it in Safari and click _Submit_ button

h3. Expected Result
Feedback should be submitted successfully

h3. Actual Result
Getting an error when users clicking _submit_ button

h3. Error Message
{noformat}Oops! Something went wrong...
AJAX error thrown: SyntaxError: JSON Parse error: Unexpected identifier "XSRF"
Don't worry though! We've logged this problem and will look into it soon!{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Enable third party cookies in Safari:
* Click the "Safari" menu
* Click "Preferences..."
* Click the "Privacy" menu
* For "Cookies and websites data" select "Always allow"

Another solution is to use a different browser.

h3. Notes
Tested on Safari, Firefox, Chrome, and Opera for iOS. Safari and Firefox hit the bug but Chrome and Opera worked fine.

This bug is connected to JRA-32285 and now displays the error message that third party cookies are disabled even before user submits the form.
fields.summary: Unable to to send a feedback from Issue Collector using Safari

fields.description:
A bug is happening on import of projects from Bitbucket to JIRA. When issues are imported to a JIRA project, their issue types are requested, as the image below shows:
!mapping_importing_issues_bitbucket_jira.png!

The available issue types are not the ones in the project’s ‘Issue Type Scheme’ and when selected an issue type that is not one of the types available for the project, an error occurs.
This is the error
!error_importing_bitbucket.png!
It reads ‘Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=1, summary=Test issue, issueType=1}’

When checking the logs, the follow stacktrace is present for the error:
{noformat}
ERROR - Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=2, summary=Mode command text moves when mouse is held down, issueType=1}
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Unable to create or update issue: ExternalIssue{externalId=2, summary=Mode command text moves when mouse is held down, issueType=1}
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:903)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:764)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:390)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
...
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a project in JIRA that does not contain all issue types
* Create a project in BitBucket and create issues
* Import the project in Bitbucket to the project in JIRA
* Map some issue types (with existent issues in BitBucket) in the project to types that are not mapped to the project
* Begin import
* The error will occur

*Workarounds*
* Check carefully the types to make sure no type is mapped to unmapped types in the project
fields.summary: Failure to import from BitBucket when mapped issue types are not present in destination project's 'Issue Type Scheme'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA notifications are not appearing in Workbox in Confluence after JIRA was updated to 7.0.0-OD-01. Confluence notifications _do_ still show in Workbox.

h3. Environment
Confluence & JIRA Cloud

h3. Description
from [Workbox Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Workbox+Notifications]
{quote}
If your Confluence site is linked to JIRA, you will also see the following JIRA notifications in your workbox:
* Comments on issues that you are watching.
* Mentions.
* Shares of issues, filters and searches.
{quote}

None of those appear in Workbox on the Confluence side.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Watch an issue in JIRA
# Tell another user to leave a comment on the issue
# Click on the Workbox notifications icon in Confluence

*Expected results:* Notifications of the comment is listed in Workbox.
*Actual results:* No notification appears.

h3. Cause
The two plugins that provide this functionality from the JIRA side were mistakenly removed from JIRA 7.0.0-OD-01.

h3. Workaround
Right now there is unfortunately no workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence's Workbox is not displaying notifications from JIRA due to Workbox plugins missing from JIRA 7.0.0-OD-01

no workaround

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start with JIRA 6.4-OD-13.
# Create a new custom field of type "Date Picker".
# Create a simple CSV file:
{code}
Summary,Date Picker
Test Issue 1,5/Feb/15
Test Issue 2,10/Feb/15
Test Issue 3,24/Feb/15
{code}
# Import that file using the JIRA Importers Plugin's CSV Importer (use "dd/MMM/yy" for the date format), note that the Date Picker field is populated in all three imported issues.
# Upgrade to JIRA 6.4-OD-14 or 15, repeat this process.

h3. Expected results
All issues are imported and the Date Picker field is correctly populated with the date specified in the CSV.

h3. Actual results
The issues are imported successfully, but on "Test Issue 3", the Date Picker field isn't filled in and JIM returns a message at the end of the import process: 
bq. Cannot add value [ Tuesday 12:00 AM ] to CustomField Date Picker in Issue null. Exception Message: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy".

That message will show for _any_ date that's within the last 7 days. So if the import is run today (the 2nd of March), it'll occur only for the 24th of February onwards. Come tomorrow, it'll be the 25th, and so on.
fields.summary: CSV Import with date field fails to import when dates are within the last 7 days

fields.description:
h2. Issue

It appears that after the update to JIRA 6.5-OD-01, the JIRA calendar plugin day filter is returning an incorrect response.

h2. Detail

Clicking on the day number on the calendar used to create a filter which would allow you to see issues on that day. It now appears to use the last saved filter which you entered into search.
fields.summary: Calendar plugin day filter returning incorrect response

fields.description:
If the data format from Look and Feel page is changed and a Release Date for a version is set, then when releasing a version from Release Hub the date in the calendar is set using the same format specified in the Look and Feel instead  of d/MMM/yy.

*To reproduce:*
# Change the Day/Month/Year format from Look and Feel page, set something like MMM d, yyyy
# Create a new version
# Go to Manage Versions and set the release date. It will be shown like: Jul 18, 2016
# Go to Release Hub of the new project view. (Select project from the Projects top menu then "Releases")
# Click on the version and do Release

Result: When the release dialog is shown, the date will be displayed as Jul 18, 2016. Clicking on release will display a message saying that the date format should be d/MMM/yy.

Expected: Date format is d/MMM/yy in calendar when doing a release from Release Hub.

To complete the Release, the change can be set manually again.
fields.summary: Release date is set using the preset date format instead of the calendar format and user has to manually change it

h3. Notes
Have seen this occur on multiple plugins

h3.Workaround
# Set the {{Prevent password reuse}} to *never* in _Password Policy_
# Re-install the add-ons or disable and enable the add-ons
fields.summary: Cannot install new Add-ons in Cloud

fields.description:
When selecting an issue in the Issue Navigator the detail panel will remain blank after around 60 seconds an error is displayed.

*Unexpected error*
"There was an unexpected error while loading the issue."

!unexpected_error.png|thumbnail!

When an issue opened directly (example: https://<your instance here>.atlassian.net/browse/JRA-101), the page will not finish loading.
No error is displayed and the page remain empty.

*Workaround*

In the Manage Addons administration panel find *Atlassian Connect - Plugin*.
Disable the addon and re-enable the addon
fields.summary: Unable to open JIRA issues in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
1. Create first project using Simple Issue Tracking
2. Open create issue dialog
3. Configure Fields -> Where is my field
4. Enter field "Fix Version/s"

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/51242/SiDnhbEXms9fUKv/Screen%20Shot%202014-11-10%20at%2012.53.45%20pm.png!
fields.summary: "Where is my field?" dialog returning error on fresh instance

fields.description:
In our Jira instance, workflow post functions are displaying radically different from what they should be.

Example 1:
I have a post function that is supposed to set the resolution field to "Work Approved." It is listed in post functions as "Only users in project role Product Manager can execute this transition."

Example 2:
I have a post function that is supposed to set the resolution field to "Validated." It is listed in post functions as "Type: class
Class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction
Arguments:
field.name = resolution
full.module.key = com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.workflowupdate-issue-field-function
field.value = 10200"
fields.summary: Workflow post functions displaying incorrectly.

fields.description:
Text and Story Points fields are not appearing on their respective screens, despite the fact that the 'Where is my field?' helper says it should be appearing on it.

h4.Workaround:
- Go to the Custom Fields screen (g+g "custom fields")
- Click the Cog menu on the right of the screen for the desired field and select 'Configure'
- Click the 'Edit Configuration' link for the 'Applicable contexts for scheme:' option
- At the 'Issue Types' multi select box, select all issue types, instead of the single 'Any issue type' option
- Save and trigger a background reindex
fields.summary: Some Custom fields don't appear on screens

fields.description:
When searching for UTF-8 or UTF-16 in the search field, we get redirected to:
/browse/UTF-8

rather than:

/issues/?jql=text ~ "UTF-8"

This bug affected https://jira.atlassian.com as well, not just our installation
fields.summary: Cannot search for "UTF-8" or "UTF-16" in the search box in Jira

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have Project A (PA) with one issue on it (ISS-1)
# Have Project B (PB)
# Set ISS-1 to Done (make the Resolution Done)
# On PB workflow, set post-function to Clear Resolution on To Do status e.g..
# Move ISS-1 (Done) to PB (To Do)

*Expected Results:*
# The issue would go through the transition on the To Do status and the post-function would be fired.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing happens. There is no history of this ticket going through any transition. No post-functions are fired.

*Workaround:*
For this specific example, a workaround could be to have this ticket going through this transition by itself. 

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v6.5-OD-05-041

*Notes:*
Also, I've tested and no validators are respected as well.
E.g.: add a validator (required field) on To Do, moving an issue does not ask me to fill out the required field.
fields.summary: Move Issue does not perform a transition issue

fields.description:
JIRA Issues Calendar gadget shows an error message when a specific version is selected. Issue affects latest Cloud deployment.

Steps to reproduce:
# Add JIRA Issues Calendar gadget to the dashboard
# Filter it to a project
# Look for a date where a specific version is listed
# Click on the version

There's no workaround at the moment for this issue
fields.summary: Jira Issues Calendar Plugin displays an error when selecting a version

fields.description:
When editing a Notification Scheme or a Permission Scheme and setting any of the options to a group, the Group selector is case sensitive.

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to the User Management and create a new group which name contains a capitol letter
# Navigate to JIRA Administration, Issues tab
#  Select either Notification or Permission Schemes on the left
# Edit any of the existing schemes
# Click the Add link under the Operations column
# In the group selector start typing the group's name
fields.summary: Group selector for Notification or Permission schemes is case sensitive

fields.description:
Deleting Sub Task from Parent Task at Issue Navigator Removes the Parent Task from View. See screenshot below:

!Screen Shot 2015-01-07 at 9.25.55 PM.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to Reproduce*

Delete a sub task using the action menu like the screenshot above.

*Expected Result*

Sub task is removed. But parent task is still viewable.

*Actual Result*

Parent task is not visible from the issue navigator. A refresh is required to display the parent task again.

!Screen Shot 2015-01-07 at 9.26.14 PM.png|thumbnail!

NOTE: This does not delete the parent task, it is just removed from view until the issue navigator is refreshed or re-running the search query.
fields.summary: Deleting Sub Task from Parent Task at Issue Navigator Removes the Parent Task from View

fields.description:
some days ago, I added an issue here on this platform, clicked save but after some time of waiting, the dialog was still open and no error visible (or I didn't see it because it automatically disappeared after a few seconds)

today, same problem, but now I have a log:

{code}13:10:25.432 "ajax[47365423] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 0,
statusText  : timeout,
hasData     : false,
readyState  : 0,
requestId   : 47365423,
aborted     : true,
}"1 batch.js:206:328
{code}

BUT: searching for it in the backend using another tab still confirms that the issue has already been created and there was no "sent" timeout but perhaps one getting the "ok" back?

That's a pity, because leaving the user not know about what happened, he will press "create" again ... and again ... and unwillingly creating lots of dups.

would be great if there might be a better check avoiding identical duplicates?
fields.summary: timeout on creating issue will often lead to duplicate issues

fields.description:
Its currently not possible to filter Issues by the "Account" Field (formerly "Tempo Account"). Reindexing did not resolve the problem.

Doing so results in an empty search result. 

JIRA Cloud Version: 6.4-OD-13-024
Current Version of Tempo Accounts: 1.2

Expample JQL: Account in accountsByCustomer("<Customername>")
Result: Empty search result.
Expected Result: Issues with an Account assigned to customer "<Customername>"
.
fields.summary: Can't filter by "Account" (formerly "Tempo Account") field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the x axis of the _Created vs Resolved Chart_, where the date labels are displayed, the last label is missing, even when there are data points for that period.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add the  _Created vs Resolved Chart_ gadget to a JIRA dashboard; make sure there is data to display in it. Any settings can be used in the 'Period' and 'Days Previously' options.

h3. Expected Results
Date labels are displayed for all periods on the x axis.

h3. Actual Results
The leftmost data labels aren't displayed. Users need to hover over a data point to see related dates.  
 
h3. Notes & Workaround
This only affects the dashboard gadget, not the chart displayed under *Project > Reports > Created vs Resolved Issues Report*. This report can be used instead when it's crucial to show the detailed date information.
fields.summary: Most Recent Date Label is Not Displayed in the Created vs Resolved Chart

fields.summary: Installing of JIRA Add-On does not complete due to DH Keypair

fields.description:
When you go to the Issue search/issue navigator, it appears to be completely broken. There's no way to search. The only buttons available are "Share", "Export", and "Tools" and they don't do anything when clicked.

Other strange problems may also crop up, this occurs if JIRA Service Desk isn't licensed, as it causes problems with rendering some of the javascript used within JIRA. If you're seeing strange behaviour please try the workaround below.

*Workaround*
Go to the *Manage add-ons* page and disable the *JIRA Service Desk* plugin.
fields.summary: Issue search screen filter options not displaying - and other miscellaneous problems

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1) Log into JIRA
2) Create Three new Simple Issue Tracking Project (e.g. Project1, Project2, Project3)
3) Go to Projects Menu then View All Projects.
4) Navigate trough all 3 projects and observe the project key in the URL and the project name shown at the page.
5) See video attached
 
*Expected Results:*
When navigating through projects it should lead you to the correct pages (clicking on Project1 leads you to Project1 page and so on)
*Actual Results:*
When navigating for example to Project2 it sometimes leads you to the Project1 or Project3 page (also the project key within the URL is right, but the page name is wrong)

Environment Information (In the Environment Field):
Software Version JIRA v6.4-OD-15-055
fields.summary: Project navigation leading to wrong page

fields.description:
When a user selects some text with an image and copies it on Word, nothing is pasted on JIRA.

h1. Steps to reproduce
# open a document on Word 2011
# select some text along with an image
# copy it (Command + C)
# paste it (Command + V) on a JIRA text field

h1. Expected Behavior
# content is pasted on JIRA

h1. Actual Behavior
# nothing is pasted
fields.summary: Copying and pasting text with images from Word does not work

fields.description:
JIRA Cloud had a default Incoming Email Server, the 'POP Mail Server', that reads emails from a local email (jira@instance.atlassian.net). 

This server _shouldn't be modified by the users_. However modifying it is possible and changing the password makes the server fails and the user is unable to change it back, as they don't know the previous email, generated by JIRA.

When testing the connection once the password is changed, we see this error:

{noformat}
Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:
AuthenticationFailedException: Authentication failed.
{noformat}

!password_error.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to the Incoming Mail page (g+g and enter Incoming Mail)
# Click 'Edit' next to the default 'POP Mail Server' 
# Select 'Change Password'
# Click 'Test Connection'
# The error will happen
# If 'Update' is selected, this configuration will be registered and the user won't be able to modify it

*Expected Behavior*
* User is not allowed to change the password, by preventing the user from editing this server

*Actual Behavior*
* User can change the password

*Workaround*
* Contact support at https://support.atlassian.com for resetting this server
fields.summary: Resetting 'POP mail server' password in JIRA Cloud is possible and causes authentication error

fields.description:
Use FIREFOX and use your MacBookPro screen(not the thunderbolt):
1 - Go to an issue, for example https://26od11dog.jira-dev.com/servicedesk/agent/SANE/queues/5/SANE-1 (admin/admin to login)
2 - Hover on "Reporter" to see the bug
See attached image for example.
fields.summary: On Firefox, "Reporter:" field seems odd when email address is long enough and screen is small enough

fields.description:
After adding the 'Notify Zendesk Ticket' post function to a transition (requires the 'Zendesk for JIRA' add-on), the post function in the list appears floating over other post functions with no text. 

To illustrate:
!zd_notification_postfunction.png|thumbnail!

The plugin in this one:
{panel}
com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-pluginzendesk_for_jira__zendesk-notification-workflow
{panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Enable 'ZenDesk for JIRA add-on'
# Add the 'Notify Zendesk Ticket' post function to any transition

*Expected outcome*
* The post function occupies a line in the list. It has a text

*Actual outcome*
* There's only a '1.', with no text over the other post functions
fields.summary: 'Notify Zendesk Ticket' post function is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing JIRA Cloud, if the password policy is set to strong, the import fails with the error
 !fails.png!
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Cloud backup
 # verify that Password Policy is set to strong
 # Import JIRA backup
 *Expected Results:*
 JIRA data is imported correctly
 *Actual Results:*

 * Import fails. Logs show:
{noformat}
Unexpected error while restoring data: com.atlassian.studio.jira.importer.impl.user.CrowdRestException: The credentials should not be encrypted for the unique password check

{noformat}

 * User management gets blocked

h3. Workaround

Contact Cloud Support at support.atlassian.com
 Support will
 * restart JIRA
 * [Set the Password Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-password-requirements-744721633.html] to *Strength:* Weak, *Expiry:* Never, *Prevent Reuse:* Never
fields.summary: Import fails if Password Policy is not set to weak

fields.description:
*Problem*
Assignee post-function to default role member does not work as expected when there are groups defined in the project role

*Workaround*
Make sure they have the correct user account listed under for the Project Role for 'Users' and simply remove all groups under the 'Groups' column in the Project's Role settings.
fields.summary: Assignee Post-function to Role not working when Groups is populated

fields.description:
See comment on docs here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/02/06/Upcoming+Atlassian+Cloud+Upgrade+for+week+starting+8+February+2015?focusedCommentId=712409161#comment-712409161

Issues so far are:

* When using insert external link on selected text, sometimes it wraps the selection in square brackets others it inserts the example wiki markup (neither of which is what I want)
* When pasting over selected text inside an external link, the paste is inserted after the link instead of replacing the selected text (100% reproducible)

Raised on behalf of reporter.
fields.summary: Wiki editor not working as expected for inserting links

fields.description:
Trying to insert an Web Issue Link from the Link menu will fail if the URL contains Curly Braces

A link of the following Format will be rejected:
[http://example.com?value=\{wow}]

Curly Braces are accepted in HTTP links and JIRA shouldn't reject them.
fields.summary: Creating a Remote Web link with Curly Braces fails

fields.description:
In past versions of the Timesheet Report plugin of JIRA (2.8.2.5  Build #895) it contained user related information if "Show Details" was selected on, as per:
!Old_Timesheet_report.png|thumbnail!

In the newest version of this plugin (2.8.3.3  Build #1004), this information seems to be lost even if "Show Details" are selected:
!New_Timesheet_report.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Log work on issues;
# Generate a Timesheet report of this issues where work was logged;
# Select "Show Details".

*Expected:*
User information is there and the user can verify how much work a user has committed.

*Actual*:
There will be no user information appearing on it.

*Workaround*
The Timesheet can be exported to Excel and the user information will be available there.
fields.summary: Time Sheet Reports are not showing user related information
